title: people playing URF should keep in mind that...
body:
... **the rules still apply**. 

inting is not ok, 

flaming is not ok. 

they are still against the rules, even  in URF!

replies.body:
What do you mean by int? because generally speaking inting means someone who dies a lot. Even though the actual definition is to intentionally die. u can go 0/30 in urf it doesn't matter u can't get banned. but if you run it down, or visibly are trying to die unless a part of some strat (it happens ive done one myself). 

I played a gp game yesterday where i had 36 kills in 20 min, there team wasn't "inting" there was just nothing they could do against me.

well int means feeding on purpose with the intent to ruin the game for the other people involved in the game

intent is the key variable that riot is looking for. if you die 30+ times in an urf game because nobody thought to ban zed and you went with Teemo, then that's not inting

but if you're using the cannon to repeatedly go to the same spot and die, that's no longer a bad play. that's intent to feed. and riot will ban you for it
ok as I thought, thanks for the clarification
?? Inting is not a baneable offense, neither flame as soon as you don't use magic words

> Inting is not a baneable offense

false

>neither flame as soon as you don't use magic words

the system can detect flame without magic words in it just fine.
Anyone who tries to defend that kind of shit behavior because "it's not ranked" or whatever should get punished five times harder than normal.
You can't int in URF because it's just that easy to die, on top of how just 1 or 2 kills turn some champs into absolute monsters for the rest of the game

> [{quoted}](name=Sinful Succubus,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=fEr5O8Wq,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2019-10-31T15:28:43.303+0000)
>
> No it's not

Keep believing that. But it doesn't change facts. :/
The posts on these boards contradict your "facts"

100% true

but what happens in URF
stays in URF
